resources.string: With this button you will enter the first activity of the calibration process (step 1). Press this button if the smart suit needs to be calibrated.

Within this activity you will have to hold the smart suit vertically (all 4 sensors) for 10 seconds after pressing the startbutton. If this is done you will go automatically to the second step of the calibration process.

After finishing the first step you will arrive at the second step of the calibration process. This step needs to be done within 7 seconds. First you have to hold the smart suit vertically (all 4 sensors). When you press the startbutton you must bend the 3 upper sensors to 90 degrees and go immediately back to the vertical start postion in a smooth movement. This step will go automatically back to the main menu.
If the smart suit doesn\'t need to be calibrated, press this button and it will go immediately to the real-time activity.
This will leave the Smart Suit app. The app will be still loaded in the RAM memory after you press the "exit" button
The smart suit will send real-time data to this activity and it will visualize the position of the cyclist. What is in this activity?

- Range (input): You can change the range, when you go above/below the range you will hear a beep sound (max. range=35, min. range=5). 
- Sound (checkbox): Uncheck this box if you don't want to hear a beep sound if the range gets exceeded. 
- Range (checkbox): Check this box if you want to see the range lines (all 3 sensors are individual) If this box is unchecked than all the 3 sensors are working together and they will simulate a human body (midback, C7, head). 
- Advanced (checkbox): Uncheck this if you dont want to see the advanced data. 
- Record (button): This button will start to record the data after pressing the REC image button. The image on the button will change to a stop image and it will stop recording the data. The sensor and location data will be saved in a string while recording. If you end the recording it will upload the string to a FTP server where it will be stored in a text file (name is timestamp).
- Start (button): This will set the baseline dots, reset the position to zero and set the range. 
- Exit (button): Go back to the main menu.
Start with step 1 of the calibration process
Hold the smart suit vertically (all 4 sensors) for 10 seconds after pressing the startbutton. If this is done you will go automatically to the second step of the calibration process.
Start with step 2 of the calibration process

First you have to hold the smart suit vertically (all 4 sensors). When you press "start" you must bend the 3 upper sensors to 90 degrees and go immediately back to the vertical start postion in a smooth movement.
Here you can read the saved data from the last uploaded file. The data can be saved in the real-time data activity (REC/STOP button on the pedals of the bike).
